DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate whether long-term outcome safety wedge resection comparable segmentectomy surgical treatment early stage ( IA ) non-small cell lung cancer ( NSCLC ) . Zhang et al . perform meta-analysis 53 study suggest sublobectomy achieved survival rate comparable lobectomy select population patient Stage I NSCLC . However , one critical question need address , , sublobectomy require segmentectomy wedge resection ? Cho et al . report , pulmonary ground glass opacity ( GGO ) nodule ( Stage IA NSCLC ) , wedge resection achieve 5-year survival rate 98.6 % pure GGO group 95.5 % mixed GGO group . Cho et al . caution perform wedge resection mixed GGO nodule GGO component ≤ 75 % , due high recurrence rate . When radiology show GGO component ≥75 % , pathology usually find lesion non-invasive . Therefore , lesion potential candidate wedge resection . This randomized clinical trial ass whether wedge resection establish standard treatment Stage IA NSCLC tumor size ≤ 2 cm GGO component ≥ 75 % .
